content: Hey @Wesley Wiser , I just wanted to check in: The main task remaining related to incr-comp for the 1.54.0 release is something in the release notes providing some context from the POV of the compiler-team about is happening and what we want from our user base, Right? I think @Esteban Küber had volunteered to help write (or at least review) such text, but I don’t think they’ll be available to do so now.
I wrote a section for the release notes yesterday but haven't gotten any feedback yet: https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/870#discussion_r676916623
ah yes, you even had dialogue about it over on T-release, just found the comment
I’ll go look at it now.
Looking and commenting
heh. Hard to comment on it since it isn’t commited yet
(can’t do 2nd order derivatives; i.e. no deltas of deltas, heh…)
Commented, one nitpick and mainly one sentence added (and smaller tweaks).
The new sentence about crash reporting is something I want included, in one shape or another.
I think @Esteban Küber ’s points are very good
@Wesley Wiser @Esteban Küber is it worth pointing out that if the error occurs, its diagnostic now includes additional information about what the user should take in response?
i.e., since we’re already admitting that issues persist: In addition to saying that they are hopefully rare, we can also state that the UX is much better than it was in 1.52.0 ?
(I know the UX improvements were present in 1.52.1. But since most people didn’t re-enable incr-comp via the env var opt-in, I think its worth treating it like a “new thing” for stable in 1.54.0…)
Sure, I can add that!
Thanks both of you for taking a look!
@Wesley Wiser fyi - I just accepted @Esteban Küber's text so that we can get something in, but I am open to patches onto it
(reviewing without diffs can be a little hard)
That's helpful, thanks @simulacrum
Mentioning the new output is a good choice. Likely not needed to explain what the error looks like or the solution, which appears in the error, right?
Or maybe show the snippet so if people see it they can identify it faster :thinking:
I can see both positions :blush:
I think it would be useful to include it
Added a basic example, https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/870#discussion_r677938869. Let me know what you all think.
